Comment: Wikipedia intentionally favors secondary sources over primary sources. In practice, this means that while it is frowned upon to use first-hand accounts from people involved in an event, it is recommended to cite reporting on the same event from "trusted sources" (see: biased mainstream outlets). In other words, the bias is a feature rather than a bug. Combine this issue with ideologically motivated, largely full-time moderators and you get a site in which every page on a political topic sounds like it could've been written by the DNC and virtually every conservative political figure has a "controversies" section on their page. Wikipedia can still be useful for non-contentious subjects but it is thoroughly unreliable regarding political and religious topics.
